column4: how does NetworkManager get started up? I don't find it in any rc files
/etc/init.d/networking ??
nope. The NetworkManager daemon
try this , as rot type network-admin
network-manager, not network-admin :)
network-manager is supposed to automatically detect wireless networks.
ok, sorry for misunderstanding you then, lemme start up network-admion
so where in network-admin do I find anything about how NetworkManager is started up?
yes I do. that's been there forever. But it doesn't mention anything about network-manager
clik on ur connection, there and choose activate
I know, I'm talking over the connection right now. I think you're misunderstanding me...

my aironet card works fine, there's no problem there. But recently some news has been released about network-manager, I guess it's a tool that comes from Fedora. It should detect multiple wireless networks and give you a choice which one to connect to
don't worry about it :) you try :)
i dont think there is anything like network -manager on ubuntu
yes there is :) apt-get install network-manager
it actually starts up a daemon called NetworkManager and it listens to wireless interface (as well as wired interfaces for that matter) for network SID's
problem is that the NetworkManager daemon doesn't see my card :/
i c
despite it being an aironet card.
ndiswraooer?
no, the aironet is recognized natively by Linux
which was a good reason to purchase it.
